subject: Discrimination
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: A former women’s coach at Fresno State said she would accept a $6.62 million award so she could put an end to her high-profile sex-discrimination case against the university. A jury originally awarded the coach, Stacy Johnson-Klein, a $19.1 million judgment, but a judge last week ordered a new trial unless she accepted the smaller amount. She was the third woman in the university’s athletics department to sue for discrimination under Title IX.
